stimulusHtml: A student is constructing a capacitor using two parallel plates and a dielectric. The student intends for the capacitance to be 1 F. Once the capacitor is connected to a power supply and the charge is measured, the calculated value of the capacitance is only 0.8 F. Which of the following is a possible reason for the discrepancy?
choicesHtml: The potential difference of the power supply is half what was expected.
The dielectric constant was larger than expected.
The separation of the plates was greater than what was expected.
The area of the plates was larger than the student had anticipated.
The wires used to connect the capacitor had significant resistance.
